verses.verse: {Job Asserts His Moral Innocence} d "I made a covenant with my eyes; how, then, can I focus my attention on a virgin?
What would I have {The Heb. lacks would one have} from God above, what heritage from the Almighty on high,
if not calamity that is due the unjust, and misfortune that is due those who practice iniquity?
He watches my life, observing every one of my actions, {Lit. steps} does he not?"
{No Lies and Deception} d "If I've lived my life in the company of vanity, or run quickly to embrace deception,
let my righteousness be weighed in honest scales, and God will make known my integrity.
If I have stepped away from the way, or if my heart covets whatever my eyes see, or if some other blemish clings to my hands,
what I've planted, let another eat or let my crops be uprooted."
{No Adultery} d "If my heart has been seduced by a woman and I've laid in wait at my friend's door,
then let my wife cook {Lit. grind} for another person and may someone else sleep with her,
because something as lascivious as that is an iniquity that should be judged.
The fires of Abaddon {Or Destruction ; i. e. the realm of eternal punishment in the afterlife} will burn, {Lit. consume} disrupting every part of my eternal reward." {Lit. my harvest}
{No Abuse of Servants} d "If I've refused to help my male and female servants when they complain against me,
what will I do when God stands up to act? When he asks the questions, how will I answer him?
The one who made me in the womb made them, {Lit. him} too, didn't he? Didn't the same one prepare each of us in the womb?"
{No Injustice on the Poor} d "If I refused to grant the desire of the poor or exhausted the eyes of the widow,
if I ate my meals by myself without feeding orphans,
(even a poor man had grown up with me as if I were his father, and even though I had guided the widow {Lit. her} from the time I was born),
"if I've observed someone who is about to die for lack of clothes or if I have no clothing to give to the poor,
if he hadn't thanked me from the bottom of his heart, {Lit. hadn't blessed me from his loins} if he had not been warmed by wool from my sheep,
if I've raised my hand against an orphan when I thought I would against him in court, {Lit. when I saw help for me at the gate,}
then let my arm {Lit. side} fall from its socket; and may my arm be torn off at the shoulder.
For I'm terrified of what calamity God may have in store for me; and I cannot endure his grandeur."
{No Trust in Wealth and Heavenly Bodies} d "If I've put my confidence in gold, if I've told gold, «You're my security,'
if I've found joy in great wealth that I own, if I've earned a lot with my own hands,
if I look at the sun {Lit. light} when it shines or the moon as it rises in steady splendor,
so that in the depths of my deceived heart I worshipped them with my mouth and hands,
this is also a sin that deserves to be judged, since I would have tried to deceive {Or have denied} God above."
{No Rejoicing over the Plight of Adversary} d "Have I rejoiced in the destruction of those who hate me, or have I been happy that evil caught up with him?
No, I haven't allowed my mouth to sin by asking for his life {Lit. soul} with a curse.
People in my household have said, «We cannot find anyone who has not been satisfied with his meat,'haven't they?
No stranger ever spent the night in the street, because I opened my doors to travelers."
{No Secret Sins} d "Have I covered my transgression like other people, to conceal iniquity within myself? {Or bosom}
Have I feared large crowds? Has my family's contempt ever terrified me so that I remained silent and wouldn't go outside?"
{Request for A Hearing} d "Who will grant me a hearing? Here's my signature {Lit. seal} let the Almighty answer! Since my adversary indicted me,
I'll wear it on my shoulder, or tie it on my head for a crown!

I'll give an account for every step I've taken; I'll approach him confidently like a Commander-in-Chief." {Lit. Nagid ; i. e. a senior officer entrusted with dual roles of operational oversight and administrative authority}
{No Abuse of the Land} d "If my land were to cry out against me or if all its furrows wept as one,
If I've consumed its produce {Lit. strength} without paying for it and snuffed out the life of its owners;
may thorns spring up instead of wheat, and obnoxious weeds instead of barley." With this, Job's discourse with his friends {The Heb. lacks with his friends} is completed.
